DataElement.preferredDefinition: The quantity of human leukocyte antigens that matched between the donor and the recipient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A family of proteins that are essential for the presentation of peptide antigens on cell surfaces that modulate the host defensive activities of T-cells. This protein family includes major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I and class II proteins.:Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens._The number of human leukocyte antigens that matched between the donor and the recipient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A family of proteins that are essential for the presentation of peptide antigens on cell surfaces that modulate the host defensive activities of T-cells. This protein family includes major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I and class II proteins.

Concepts.definition: A family of proteins that are essential for the presentation of peptide antigens on cell surfaces that modulate the host defensive activities of T-cells. This protein family includes major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I and class II proteins.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens._The number of human leukocyte antigens that matched between the donor and the recipient.

Concepts.definition: Any substance, generally a protein, that stimulates the immune system and elicits an immune response.  Recognition by the immune system elicits either a T-lymphocyte response, recognizing processed antigens, or a B-lymphocyte response, producing antibodies that bind to unprocessed antigens.
The number of human leukocyte antigens that matched between the donor and the recipient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
